comments:
In the export wizard, selecting "File System" and clicking Next does nothing
except add the following to the log (edited -- contact me if you need more):

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2005-08-23 11:55:08.806
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.wizards.datatransfer.WizardFileSystemResourceExportPage1.getConflictingContainerNameFor(WizardFileSystemResourceExportPage1.java:469)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.wizards.datatransfer.WizardFileSystemResourceExportPage1.validateDestinationGroup(WizardFileSystemResourceExportPage1.java:432)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.WizardDataTransferPage.determinePageCompletion(WizardDataTransferPage.java:178)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.WizardDataTransferPage.updatePageCompletion(WizardDataTransferPage.java:321)

Is there anything selected in the checkboxes?  Is the "To directory:" field 
blank?

(In reply to comment #1)
It doesn't go past the page where you select "File System" -- there's no chance
to select a "to" directory.

Had you completed an export before this happened?  If so, from 
the .metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.ui directory, can you attach the file 
dialog_settings.xml?  Perhaps it has something to do with the last selected 
directory.

Is there anything special about your workspace (location not on local drive 
maybe or something else) or any of the projects in your workspace (located in 
another workspace, not in default location, something else)?

I haven't used File System export recently, so one unusual fact about my
workspace is that I moved it over from a Windows machine to a Mac.  I thought of
that, though, and deleted the history items from the dialog_settings.xml file
when I was trying to figure out why I couldn't do a file export.

At the time of the bug report, there was nothing else unusual about the
workspace (although since then I have created a workaround for not having file
export by creating a project whose location is on the afs server that I was
trying to export to, so I can just do a copy between projects).

I looked at this problem on the Mac for a while and it will likely require some more investigation.  But I 
have a few more questions.  

Did the problem happen the first time you tried to Export to File System after you moved the workspace 
from Windows to Mac, or had you been able to successfully do a few exports before the problem 
started happening?  

Does the problem still happen if you remove the FileSystemExportWizard section from 
dialog_settings.xml?  I wonder if the /afs/... item in your history is what's causing the problem.  

RIght now the only possibilities I can see, based on the stack trace, for the cause of the NPE is the 
location of one of the projects is null, or the workspace root location is coming back as null.  Both very 
odd things to occur, but I don't think consistency is guarantted when switching platforms and using the 
same workspace in 3.1.

The line of code where you experienced the exception was changed for 3.2 - see bug 117949.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 117949 ***
